channel.title: Jacobe - command line code cleaner
channel.description:
Credit to regex: [url=http://www.rs-resources.com/mxvfg/viewtopic.php?f=89&t=3442]here[/url] (I snipped the stuff that rly wasn't needed here as were not talking about scripting)
Part of scripting is keeping your code neat and clean so other people can fix and modify your code without a headache. Always indent consistently and never let your lines run too long! If you need help in keeping your code clean, [url=http://www.tiobe.com/jacobe.htm]jacobe[/url] can help! It is a command line tool that will beautify your code to meet the Sun standard. [b]To install:[/b] - Download jacobe from here: http://www.tiobe.com/jacobe.htm / http://www.tiobe.com/downloads/jacobe.win32.zip - Move the sun.cfg and jacobe.exe to somewhere in your PATH (your WINDOWS folder is a good idea!) [b]To use:[/b] - Open up a command prompt, or use a batch script. Jacobe is usable in the following way: [code]jacobe -overwrite -nobackup File.java[/code] It will beautify your code and save it.

item.title: Jacobe - command line code cleaner
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:6, topic:54577”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=77099.msg860053#msg860053 date=1170565739]
Then define what you mean by too many resources.
[/quote]
JIDEA is a heavy weight IDE, unlike notepad, which is faster to save / find.
(i use EditPadPro, rather then an IDE)[/quote]

One of the main reasons I like IDEs better is the colour syntax highlighting. You can’t get that with Notepad (or notepad lookalikes :))[br][size=1]Posted on: February 17, 2007, 08:18:13 AM[/size][hr]This is a great tool, I generally code very messily, but this fixed all my files in one go!

Read full topic

item.title: Jacobe - command line code cleaner
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

Credit to regex: here
(I snipped the stuff that rly wasn’t needed here as were not talking about scripting)

Part of scripting is keeping your code neat and clean so other people can fix and modify your code without a headache. Always indent consistently and never let your lines run too long!

If you need help in keeping your code clean, jacobe can help! It is a command line tool that will beautify your code to meet the Sun standard.

To install:

  • Download jacobe from here: http://www.tiobe.com/jacobe.htm / http://www.tiobe.com/downloads/jacobe.win32.zip
  • Move the sun.cfg and jacobe.exe to somewhere in your PATH (your WINDOWS folder is a good idea!)

To use:

  • Open up a command prompt, or use a batch script. Jacobe is usable in the following way:
jacobe -overwrite -nobackup File.java

It will beautify your code and save it.

Read full topic
